info.title: Greip API
info.description: This documentation provides a comprehensive guide on how to utilize the Greip API, including detailed explanations of API methods, available options, and other features to optimize your API usage.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description:
The `params` command can be used to specify the required modules you want to get in the response.

Expected values: `security`, `currency`, `timezone`, `location`, and/or `device`.

Sample value: `security,timezone,currency`.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: The `lang` command is used to get a response in a specific language.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The `format` command is used to get a response in a specific format.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: The `userID` command can be used to identify requests sent by specific users to monitor in the [Events Page](https://docs.greip.io/dashboard-guides/monitoring-capabilities/real-time-threat-monitoring).

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
The mode command is used to in the development stage to simulate the integration process before releasing it to the production environment.
 
Expected values: `live`, or `test`.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description:
The `callback` command can help you make the response as a JSONP format.

Expected values: any name that can be used as a function name in Javascript, e.g: `myFunctionName`.

get.description:
This API allows you to retrieve detailed geolocation information for a visitor’s or user’s IP address.

By using the IP Geolocation method, you can access data such as the user’s country, city, ISP, and more, enabling you to personalize user experiences, enhance security, and make data-driven decisions based on geographic insights.
get.summary: Retrieve detailed geolocation information for a visitor’s or user’s IP address

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: The `ip` command is used to specify the IP address you want to lookup.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve comprehensive information about a given IP address. It provides details such as location, ISP, and potential risk factors, enabling you to analyze and verify IP data for enhanced security, fraud prevention, and user profiling.
get.summary: Get the full information of a given IP address

get.description: Access comprehensive threat intelligence data linked to a specific IP address. This endpoint provides insights into malicious activity, reputation scoring, and potential security risks associated with the IP address.
get.summary: Retrieve threat intelligence information for a given IP address

parameters.description: The `ips` command is used to specify the IP address you want to lookup

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve information for multiple IP addresses in a single request.

By using the `/lookup/ip/bulk` method, you can efficiently gather data such as location, ISP, and risk factors for a batch of IPs, saving time and streamlining your workflow for large-scale analysis.
get.summary: Get the full information of multiple IP Addresses

parameters.name: asn
parameters.description:
The `asn` command is used to specify the AS Number you want to lookup.

Sample value: `AS6167` or `6167`

parameters.name: isList
parameters.description: Set this to `yes` if you want to list all routes of both IPv4 and IPv6.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
The `format` command is used to get a response in a specific format.

Expected values: `JSON`, `XML`, `CSV`, or `Newline`.

For more information please refer to [Response Format](https://docs.greip.io/options/response-format).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description:
The `callback` command can help you make the response as a JSONP format.

Expected values: any name that can be used as a function name in Javascript, e.g: `myFunctionName`.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
The mode command is used to in the development stage to simulate the integration process before releasing it to the production environment.
 
Expected values: `live`, or `test`.

get.description:
This API method allows you to look up any given Autonomous System Number (ASN) and retrieve comprehensive data associated with it.

The information returned includes the ASN name, organization name, country, associated domain, contact email, phone number, total IPs, and a detailed list of all related routes (both IPv4 and IPv6). This functionality is essential for network analysis, troubleshooting, and understanding the infrastructure behind IP addresses.
get.summary: Lookup any AS Number and receive it's details

parameters.name: bin
parameters.description: The BIN/IIN of the card (min: 6 digits).

get.description:
Utilize this module to effortlessly retrieve comprehensive information associated with a debit or credit card.

The API provides details such as card type (debit or credit), scheme (Visa, Mastercard, etc.), brand (gold, platinum, etc.), and bank information.

This data is invaluable for various applications, including verifying customer payment details, detecting fraudulent transactions, and delivering personalized services to enhance user experiences.
get.summary: Get the complete data associated with a debit/credit card

example.customer_useragent: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/114.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36

post.description:
Prevent financial losses and protect your business by deploying AI-powered modules that analyze transaction patterns in real-time.

This method helps identify and block suspicious activities, mitigating the risk of fraudulent payments and ensuring a secure experience for both you and your customers.
post.summary: Prevent financial losses by deploying AI-Powered modules

get.description:
This method enables you to validate International Bank Account Numbers (IBANs) and obtain essential information about the country associated with each IBAN.

By using this API, you can ensure that the IBANs are formatted correctly and gain insights into the banking institution, enhancing security and accuracy in financial transactions.
get.summary: Validate International IBANs and obtain essential information

get.description:
This method provides an additional layer of validation for your system. While validating email syntax is important, it is not sufficient.
 
This method goes beyond syntax validation by checking the domain’s validity, the availability of the Mail Service, detecting Disposable Email (Temporary Emails), etc. By utilising this method, you can ensure a more thorough validation process for email addresses.
get.summary: Validate email addresses and retrieve additional information

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: The `phone` command is used to specify the phone number you want to validate.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: The `ISO 3166-1 alpha-2` format of the country code of the phone number.

parameters.description: The `format` command is used to get a response in a specific format.

get.description:
This method serves as an additional layer of protection in your system for validating phone numbers. It not only checks the syntax but also assesses the likelihood of the phone number being valid and operational.
 
By incorporating this scoring into your workflow, you can enhance fraud detection, reduce invalid inputs, and improve the overall quality of data captured.
get.summary: Validate phone numbers and retrieve additional information

parameters.description: The `ISO 3166-1 alpha-2` format of the country code.

parameters.description: The `params` command is used to determine the data you need in the response.

get.description:
This method allows you to retrieve detailed information about a country by providing its country code in the request.

The API returns valuable data, such as the country’s name, capital, population, region, and other relevant attributes, enabling you to enrich your applications with geographic context and enhance user experiences.
get.summary: Get the full information of a country

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text you want to filter.

schema.example: This is a sample text without profanity!

1.description: Return the found bad-words as an Array.

parameters.name: listBadWords
parameters.description: Set to `yes` to list the bad-words as an Array.

0.description: Return full information about the text.

1.description: Return only the risk score of the text.

parameters.name: scoreOnly
parameters.description: Set to `yes` to return only the score of the text and whether it's safe or not.

get.description: This method helps safeguard your website or app by detecting offensive or inappropriate language in user inputs. By screening for profanity and other harmful content before it’s made public, you can maintain a positive user environment, protect your brand, and prevent abusive behavior on your platform.
get.summary: Detect profanity in a given text

get.description:
This method allows you to retrieve the IP address of your visitors or users without the need for an account or API key in Greip.

It’s a quick and easy way to access IP information, making it ideal for basic integrations or when you need to capture user IPs with minimal setup.
get.summary: Retrieve the IP address of your visitors or users without the need for an account or API key in Greip

delete.description:
In some cases, such as data protection regulations, businesses that process personal data are required to delete it upon request.

Using this method, you’ll be able to delete all data related to your user in a single request.
delete.summary: Request to delete your user data from Greip

externalDocs.description: Greip documentation that shows you how to use Greip API by highlighting its methods, options, and other features.
